alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 6:36PM EDT until July 29 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR CAMDEN...NORTHWESTERN GLOUCESTER...WEST CENTRAL BURLINGTON... SOUTHWESTERN PHILADELPHIA AND SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE COUNTIES... At 635 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Philadelphia International Airport, or near Gloucester City, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Camden, Gloucester City, Cherry Hill, Evesham, Mount Laurel, Chester, Willingboro, Deptford, Voorhees, West Deptford, Lindenwold, Bellmawr, Yeadon, Woodbury, Berlin, Palmyra, Folcroft, Swarthmore and Paulsboro. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 2 and 4. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 3 and 26. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 343 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 10 and 47. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 7. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 42 and 44. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
